A family of four making $55,000 will get a $1,500 tax cut. A single mother with one child making $30,000 will get an $800 check from the government.
The child tax credit is doubled to $2,000 per child ($1,400 of which is refundable, meaning you can benefit from it even if you have a negative tax liability and don’t owe the government any tax).

The bill cuts taxes for the middle class. The 15% bracket is cut to 12%. The 25% bracket is cut to 22%. The standard deduction (claimed by 81% of residents in Florida’s Second District) is roughly doubled to $12,000 for individuals and $24,000 for married couples. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DRq8ZY0W0AAP5CL.png
